title: Sri Lankan players are ready to play PSL in Pakistan
text:
Sri Lanka’s stand-in captain in T20Is for Lahore, Dasun Shanaka, said that all their players are ready to play the upcoming fifth edition of the Pakistan Super League (PSL) in Pakistan next year.

While talking to the media in Lahore after their convincing 64-run win against the home side in the first T20I, Shanaka expressed the overwhelming experience of playing in front of an exciting and energetic crowd.

Meanwhile, he answered a question about revisiting Pakistan in the future and said that there will be no issue in coming to Pakistan again, in fact, they are ready to play PSL in front of the cricket-loving nation.

“We wanted to visit Pakistan and we have spent quality time here so far. All Sri Lankan players are ready to play PSL in Pakistan,” he said.

For Shanaka, beating the number one T20I team is an exceptional feeling. “Beating the world’s best team in T20Is is a different feeling for us. We stuck to our plan and played with positive mindset,” he highlighted.

Shanaka praised the youngest pacer to claim a hat-trick in T20Is, Mohammad Husnain and called him a strong future prospect for Pakistan. “Husnain is an amazing talent and really worth watching him bowling with immense pace,” he marked.
